text.p: Electronics giant Sony Corp said on Friday it planned to restructure its company management in a bid to speed up policy-making and stimulate discussion at top-level meetings.
Sony said it plans to slash the number of its board of directors to 10 from 38, while increasing the number of outside directors to five or six from one.
The structural reform is subject to approval at a shareholders' meeting on June 27, Sony said.

Most of the current board of directors will become corporate executive officers, who will oversee operations and management of relevant business sectors, rather than taking part in overall corporate policy-making.

Sony also announced that it planned to appoint Kenichi Suematsu, chairman of Sakura Bank Ltd, and Hideo Ishihara, chairman of Goldman Sachs (Japan) Ltd, as outside directors. Currently, Peter Peterson, chairman of the Blackstone Group, is the company's sole outside director.
